title._content: San Francisco Mt. from its base (LOC)

description._content: O'Sullivan, Timothy H.,, 1840-1882,, photographer. San Francisco Mt. from its base [United States], 1871. 1 photographic print on stereo card : stereograph, albumen. Notes: Original negative number: 158. Title from item. Part of series: U.S. War Dept., Corps of Engineers; Geographical Explorations and Surveys West of 100th Meridian, Expedition of 1871; Lieut. Geo. M. Wheeler, commanding. Part of: Arizona Series. Photograph shows the photographer's "portable developing box, ten-by-twelve-inch large-plate camera, and pack mule with members of the Wheeler survey." (Source: Framing the West) Published in: Framing the West: The Survey Photographs of Timothy H. O'Sullivan / Toby Jurovics, Carol M. Johnson, Glenn Willumson, and William F. Stapp. New Haven: Yale University Press, 2010, p. 26. Exhibited: Framing the West, Smithsonian American Art Museum, 2010. Subjects: Photographic apparatus & supplies--Arizona--1860-1870. Format: Expedition photographs--1860-1870. Stereographs--1870-1880. Albumen prints--1870-1880. Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA Persistent URL: hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/stereo.1s00180 hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/cph.3a27345 Call Number: LOT 3427-1, no. 36 [item]
